alert.note: Alert for Dearborn; Ohio; Switzerland (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 13 at 4:26PM EDT until July 13 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...The following counties, in Southeast Indiana, Dearborn, Ohio and Switzerland. * WHEN...Until 545 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 425 PM EDT, while the heaviest rain is winding down, additional storms could bring areas of heavy rain through 5:30PM. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Aurora, Rising Sun, Pleasant, French, Hartford, Pate, Aberdeen, Bear Branch, Rabbit Hash and Avonburg.
info.instruction: Keep children away from storm drains, culverts, creeks and streams. Water levels can rise rapidly and sweep children away. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
